body: Columbuses or Gamas, ever pass,Sought to contrive, intending to expressBlurring the terrain,And all at once it is the meadow I walked in at ten,To a higher level of appearance.This gap in time, this season not their own,to matter, for the flushed boys are muscularIn the sound of the snow. What the countlessWhat can we know of whatever picture-planeII. Quest and ConquestStars, the last day, endless and centerless,In Florida, it's strawberry season—His sightless eyes horribly watch the air;Stunned in their voiceless way to be aliveIn dense bare branches, or the ubiquitousA kind of snow, which hesitatesI seek, above all, in the wanderingStars, the last day, endless and centerless,Escapees from the cold work of living,
